Vizio Co-Star

Last updated: 26 February 2014

Runs Chrome

HTML5 Test: 338/500

As of December 2012. Source: html5test.com

CSS3 Test: 48%

As of December 2012. Source: css3test.com

Acid 3 Test: Untested

As of December 2012. Source: acid3.acidtests.org

Second generation Google TV. Runs Android and apps can be downloaded from Google Play.

The trackpad on the remote takes a lot of getting used to. Scrolling may seem the wrong way round to some users, and tracking is fast. Therefore users may find it easier to navigate using d-pad. Strongly recommend testing sites with the remote.

There are buttons on both sides of the remote. The back of the remote has a full QWERTY keyboard.

More about Google TV

Support Details

Source: Support Details by Imulus, tested December 2012.

Operating System Linux
Screen Resolution 1844 x 1034
Web Browser Chrome 11.0.696.77
Browser Size 1024 x 574
Color Depth 16
Javascript Enabled
Flash Version 10.2.164
Cookies Enabled
User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux armv7l) AppleWebKit/534.24 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/11.0.696.77 Large Screen Safari/534.24 GoogleTV/000000

Media query tests

Source: Palm Reader, December 2012.

What the device can read:

  • screen
  • color
  • orientation:landscape
  • min-device-width
  • max-device-width
  • min-device-height
  • max-device-height
  • min-width
  • max-width
  • min-height
  • max-height

What the device says it isn't:

  • print
  • tv
  • color
  • color-index
  • monochrome
  • handheld
  • projection
  • (orientation : portrait)
  • (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2)
  • (scan:progressive)
  • (scan:interlace)
  • (grid)
  • (pointer:coarse)
  • (pointer:fine)
  • (pointer:none)
  • (min-resolution)
  • (max-resolution)
  • (luminosity:normal)
  • (luminosity:dim)
  • (luminosity:washed)
  • (hover)
  • (script)

Contribute

All of the devices, except the ones I've borrowed like the Wii, Xbox and PS3, live in Clearleft's test lab which is open for anyone to drop by and use. I've bought most of the consoles on this site, although a couple have been kindly donated.

If you'd like to contribute, or if you already own one of these devices and you don't want it any more, please have a look at my wishlist of consoles and peripherals I don't yet have in the test lab. Post it to Clearleft to form part of their test lab, and I'll run lots of tests on it and document them on this site. I look for second-hand models with all the cables. I got the PS Vita for a bargain because it had a dead pixel. The DSi was missing the box and the stylus, but it doesn't matter as long as all the buttons and screen work so I can properly test the browser in them.
